rev.comment: again, the patent license is separated from the software license
rev.diff:
Line 19: Line 19:
'''WebM''' is a [[container format (digital)|video format]] designed to provide [[royalty free]] high quality [[video compression]] in an [[open format]] for use with [[HTML5 video]]. The project's development is sponsored by [[Google]].
'''WebM''' is a [[container format (digital)|video format]] designed to provide [[royalty free]] high quality [[video compression]] in an [[open format]] for use with [[HTML5 video]]. The project's development is sponsored by [[Google]].
â
A WebM file consists of [[VP8]] video and [[Vorbis]] audio streams, in a container based on a [[Profile (engineering)|profile]] of [[Matroska]].<ref>{{citation |url=http://webmproject.blogspot.com/2010/05/introducing-webm-open-web-media-project.html |title=Introducing WebM, an open web media project |accessdate=2010-05-19 |date=2010-05-19 |first1=Jeremy |last1=Doig |first2=Mike |last2=Jazayeri |publisher=WebM Project}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.webmproject.org/about/faq/ |title=WebM FAQ |date=2010-05-19}}</ref><ref>{{citation |url=http://www.xiph.org/press/2010/webm/ |title=Xiph.Org announces support for the WebM open media project |first=Chris |last=Montgomery |authorlink=Chris Montgomery |accessdate=2010-05-20 |date=2010-05-19 |publisher=[[Xiph.Org Foundation|Xiph]]}}</ref> The project releases WebM related software under a [[BSD License]] with [[software patent|patent]] clause.
+
A WebM file consists of [[VP8]] video and [[Vorbis]] audio streams, in a container based on a [[Profile (engineering)|profile]] of [[Matroska]].<ref>{{citation |url=http://webmproject.blogspot.com/2010/05/introducing-webm-open-web-media-project.html |title=Introducing WebM, an open web media project |accessdate=2010-05-19 |date=2010-05-19 |first1=Jeremy |last1=Doig |first2=Mike |last2=Jazayeri |publisher=WebM Project}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.webmproject.org/about/faq/ |title=WebM FAQ |date=2010-05-19}}</ref><ref>{{citation |url=http://www.xiph.org/press/2010/webm/ |title=Xiph.Org announces support for the WebM open media project |first=Chris |last=Montgomery |authorlink=Chris Montgomery |accessdate=2010-05-20 |date=2010-05-19 |publisher=[[Xiph.Org Foundation|Xiph]]}}</ref> The project releases WebM related software under a [[BSD License]] and all users are granted a worldwide, non-exclusive, no-charge, royalty-free patent license.
